channel.title: Built-In Synthesizer
channel.description: I know people really want this to be a thing, so we don't have the same sounds used over and over in a single track, but would you guys consider adding a synthesizer with a few modulation options (i.e. waveform, detune, etc.) to make it easy to make unique sounds in Auxy. I know that it may be harder for new users to make new sounds with it, and it may cause a bit more lag, but it would really help influence our creativity in Auxy.

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
We’re working on something like this.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Alyen:

Couldn’t a solution to the business side of thing, be to create and sell preset packs?

That’s effectively what we have now.
I didn’t mean to suggest that it would kill the model, just muddy it a bit.
There is a reasonably lively market for synth/VST patch kits, with many producers out there releasing direct.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: Alyen
item.description:
akabillposters:

I think it would be great for users, but possibly not so great for the business model, which currently relies on selling soundpacks because users don’t have the tools to generate sounds from scratch themselves.

Couldn’t a solution to the business side of thing, be to create and sell preset packs?

Read full topic

item.description:
Totally makes sense. But I wonder if maybe then we could have a way to interchange drums & each individual sound because i will find myself liking a kick on this kit, but the snare sounds better on this one and stuff like that.

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
This is something we’ve been thinking about and it could make sense for specific cases, e.g. we could perhaps design a simple (in its controls) little bass synth. There is already a powerful synth running in the background. We use it to make the sounds and, to simplify, you could say that it’s a combination of a sampler and Serum (i.e. Serum the commercially available plugin). It has lots of knobs so making everything available would be more chaotic than useful. I also think it’s quite hard to make sounds that good and unique. It won’t be a simple as giving people a lot of knobs and get better sounding tracks in return unfortunately.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer

item.description:
i don’t think it’s necessary. there are lots of synthesizer apps out there. let’s keep auxy simple as it is.

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: Haxerist
item.description:
But the whole point of Auxy is making it simple yet amazing, and easy to use, so I don’t think having a synthesizer would fit the goal Auxy’s devs have in mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
I agree, the soundpacks are the best sounds I’ve heard. The pianos sound better than the piano sound in most paid software.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
kiP:

using the sounds from packs would feel cheap and overused.

Over-used? Potentially – assuming the flow was similar to now.
Cheap? I’m not sure.

As mentioned, the learning curve associated with proper synthesis means it takes time, experience and talent to create sounds of the character and quality we’ve been getting in SoundPacks.

I know some balk at the cost, but they do represent incredible value for money.

Even if they did introduce a synth tool, at £5 per pack, I’d still be buying them – as well as playing around with the synth. But, that’s just me.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Agreed, if there was a synthesizer to create your own sounds, then using the sounds from packs would feel cheap and overused.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I think it would be great for users, but possibly not so great for the business model, which currently relies on selling soundpacks because users don’t have the tools to generate sounds from scratch themselves.

DH0:

had a dream where the new soundpack was one fully customizable synth.

Could impact future sales of soundpacks.

That said, it may be that this section of the market – the non-pro, ‘serious hobbyist’ – might be the one market segment where that would work.
Enough users might not get into the synth*, and so might still find themselves falling back on buying ready-made soundpacks, and tweaking from there.

The same point could probably be made about adding a sampler.

 
* It’s not actually so simple to get a fresh, usable range of great sounds out when you’re starting from scratch. There’s a bit of a learning curve to synthesis.

Keep in mind also that one of the driving principles of Auxy is not to be an ‘anything goes’ music production tool/instrument/mini-DAW – but one aimed at making (quality) music production more accessible by making it simpler. This means a full-featured synth is less likely.

 
Just thinking out loud. Could be wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Built-In Synthesizer
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
I’d love this. I actually once had a dream where the new soundpack was one fully customizable synth.

Read full topic

I know that it may be harder for new users to make new sounds with it, and it may cause a bit more lag, but it would really help influence our creativity in Auxy.
